title: Mathlib Imports
content: We import Mathlib.NumberTheory.PythagoreanTriples which provides the complete theory of Pythagorean triples, including the classification theorems.

title: Historical Context
content: Wiedijk 100 Theorems #23: The formula for Pythagorean triples was known to ancient Babylonians. Every primitive triple has the form a = m^2 - n^2, b = 2mn, c = m^2 + n^2.

title: Pythagorean Triple Predicate
content: A Pythagorean triple is three integers (x, y, z) satisfying x^2 + y^2 = z^2.

title: Classification Theorems
content: Main Theorem: Every Pythagorean triple is classified via the parametric formula. Primitive triples have gcd = 1.

title: Formula Generates Valid Triples
content: The parametric formula always produces valid Pythagorean triples via algebraic verification.

title: Classical Examples
content: Famous triples: (3,4,5) from m=2,n=1; (5,12,13) from m=3,n=2; and more.

title: Properties
content: Key properties: symmetry, zero triple, parity constraints.

title: Unit Circle Parametrization
content: The formula comes from rational points on the unit circle via stereographic projection.

title: Scaling and Summary
content: Non-primitive triples are scalar multiples of primitive ones. Complete classification established.
